subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Libythea geoffroyi alompra
is similar to other subspecies of
L. geoffroyi ,
but differs in that its forewing dorsum of male is with wide dark brown band along outer margin, as wide as half the length of CuA 2 ; dark brown band separates blue proximal area from white subapical marks in cells Rs 4 , M 1 and M 2 .

Type Examined.
Libythea alompra
Moore 1901
, HOLOTYPE : ♂ , Myanmar : Ataran Valley , III-[18]94, Hauxwell ( BMNH ).

Distribution. Southern China , Laos , Myanmar , and Thailand .
Remark. Only male specimens were obtained during this study, but Igarashi & Fukuda (2000) illustrated a female and that drawing was studied.
